name: Fine arts
description: Belonging to the Arts, Fine arts is the study of visual forms of creative expression, encompassing theory, history, techniques, performance, and production in areas such as painting and sculpture. [cite: 73, 74]

name: Art theory
description: The study of the philosophical and theoretical underpinnings of art, a component of Fine arts. [cite: 74]

name: Calligraphy
description: The art of beautiful handwriting, considered a visual art form within Fine arts. [cite: 74]

name: Etching
description: A printmaking technique using acid to incise a design into a metal plate, studied as part of Fine arts. [cite: 74]

name: Fine art printmaking
description: The creation of artworks by printing, normally on paper, but also on other surfaces, a discipline within Fine arts. [cite: 74]

name: History of art
description: The academic study of the history and development of the visual arts, an integral part of Fine arts. [cite: 74]

name: Painting
description: The practice of applying paint, pigment, color or other medium to a solid surface, a primary discipline in Fine arts. [cite: 74]

name: Philosophy of art
description: A branch of philosophy that explores the nature of art, including concepts such as interpretation, representation, expression, and form, studied within Fine arts. [cite: 74]

name: Sculpture
description: The art of making two- or three-dimensional representative or abstract forms, especially by carving stone or wood or by casting metal or plaster, a key area of Fine arts. [cite: 74]
